page.title: 19Ornithology in Waverton.
page.content: Hockenhull's wet meadow and ancient hedgerows attract many migrant species from Africa including the Cuckoo (2_3) pair,and leafwarblers,Whitethroats, ChiffChaff,Blackcap,Garden,Sedge and Willow Warblers.Ground nesting species Reed Bunting,Meadow Pipit,Skylark and Linnet are the host species for the Cuckoo.Curlew,Snipe,Teal and Tufted duck frequent the marsh together with Lapwing, and Golden Plover in severe Winters.The Poplartrees attract Lesser and Greater Spotted woodpeckers whilst the hawthorn berries are food for Red wing and Fieldfare from Sweden. Tawny Owl is resident,and Little and Barn Owl recorded.The most common species are Blackbird,Robin,Wren,Song Thrush, Dunnock,Great Tit and Blue Tit. There is a resident Kestrel and occasional Buzzard,Heron,Swan,Common Sandpiper and Dabchick can also be seen there.
